channel.title: Perl Weekly newsletter
channel.description: A free, once a week e-mail round-up of hand-picked news and articles about Perl.

item.title: Escape London -- Mid-to-Senior Perl Developers in the Midlands (visa sponsorship possible)
item.description: Varied role solving real business problems for clients, working with open source software all day - in one of the few places in the UK a house is still affordable.

item.title: The only Perl job with a swimming pool; very exciting financial services company in London, The EU
item.description: he best thing â€” in my opinion, anyway â€” about working for a development team led by an active member of the London Perl community, is that you know management love Perl, support using the best available Perl tooling, and will create a technical environment where Perl developers will be happy.

item.title: Science background, or a passing interest in life sciences? Junior/mid-level Perl developer needed in London...
item.description: Friendly and quiet office in London (W1) looking for a Perl (or similar) developer with at least two years experience. Youâ€™re expected to have fullstack experience/abilities, from improvements on the clientâ€™s HTML front-end to backend services.

item.title: Docker Image Vulnerability Research
item.description: Apparently, 24% of latest Docker images have significant vulnerabilities.

item.title: Launching PokÃ©mon Go
item.description: Phil Keslin, CTO of Niantic, explains how the engineering team prepared for--and just barely survived--the experience of launching PokÃ©mon Go.

item.title: The Gift of Feedback (in a Booklet)
item.description: Giving and receiving feedback can help both individuals and projects. But done wrong it can just plain suck, and when you're doing open source for fun, it can really suck. Pat shares some tips from colleagues, on giving and receiving feedback.

item.title: Komodo 10.2.1 Released
item.description: ActiveState have released a new version of the Komodo IDE. No new features, but a bunch of fixes.

item.title: Dave Mitchell's February 2017 report
item.description: The monthly update on Perl 5 work done by Dave Mitchell, supported by a Perl 5 development grant.

item.title: What Training Should I Run In Amsterdam?
item.description: Dave wants to know what training course he should run at YAPC::Europe this year. If you care, let him know please.

item.title: TVPM Tech Talks in Reading, UK
item.description: We're having a session of short tech talks at Thames Valley Perl Mongers, next Monday (27th March), if you fancy joining us? Topics are PDF::API2, synchronising databases, custom reports for Netdisco, packaging for Debian, and the River of CPAN.

item.title: Current working directory in Perl (cwd, pwd)
item.description: Gabor introduces the Cwd module, and shows the differences between the cwd() and getcwd() functions.

item.title: Coding for Pi Day
item.description: Dave does some Pi-related hacking in Perl, in honour of Pi day.

item.title: Plotting using Matplotlib and Inline::Python
item.description: Moritz plots some data in Perl 6, in another extract from his Perl 5 book.

item.title: Considering hyper/race semantics
item.description: Jonathan introduces hyper and race, two Perl 6 methods which will be getting nailed down in the next release of the Perl 6 language definition, 6.d (the language is defined by the testsuite).

item.title: Tidy Da Tags
item.description: The weekly round-up of Perl 6 news, the headline for which was DrForr's first release of Perl6::Tidy.

item.title: Wrapping a C shared library with Perl and XS
item.description: Stealing the first line of Steve's post: this tutorial shows how to wrap a C shared library using XS and Perl (including creating a trivial test shared library).

item.title: Fast and secure Perl docs and CPAN modules with help from Fastly
item.description: The cpan.org and perldoc.perl.org sites are now available using https, and are CDNified thanks to Fastly. Thanks to Fastly.

item.title: P5P Mailing List Summary: March 6th-12th
item.description: Sawyer's weekly update from the P5P mailing list.

item.title: DBIx::Custom 0.38 release
item.description: Kimoto-san has released a new version of DBIx::Custom, dropping some features that have been deprecated for the last 5 years.

item.title: NICEPERL's lists
item.description: Miguel Prz (NICEPERL)'s regular lists: Great modules released last week; MetaCPAN weekly report; StackOverflow Perl report.

item.title: #295 - Tech talks in Reading, UK next Monday
item.description:
What's the use of being an editor of Perl Weekly, if I can't occasionally abuse that privilege to promote my local Perl Mongers group? Five of us are giving short tech talks next Monday (27th), if you fancy joining us.

Neil
item.dc:subject: list of tags?
